channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Hiker Rescue; INC#1258; 05:27PM; 636 S Topanga Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Nk3MDs; #PacificPalisades; Three uninjured hikers are lost in a remote area south of Trippet Ranch. LAFD Air Ops will be hoisting them, and bringing them back to a landing zone, where LAFD ground crews will assist them in getting back to their vehicle. Nothing further.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC9 E23 E269 E90 H4 H7 HA4 HA7 RA23 RH114 T69; CH7; 1; Nicholas Prange

Auto vs Pedestrians; INC#1259; 05:28PM; 6161 W Pico Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3P1XXvw; #Carthay; One vehicle struck three pedestrians on the sidewalk (no entrapment) and collided with a building. Firefighter-Paramedics treated four (driver included, who declined transport) and transported three patients. A 48-year-old female and 51-year-old male were treated and transported, both in serious condition, and a 19-year-old male was transported in fair condition. ; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 E261 E292 E43 E58 E68 EM11 EM14 EM9 HR3 RA43 RA58 RA61 RA68 RA94 T61 T92; CH7; 14; Nicholas Prange

Update Technical Rescue; INC#0447; 10:45AM; 10505 N Glenoaks Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/43s4JPo; #Pacoima; Firefighters extricated the trapped worker at the construction site, but sadly, the victim had perished under the rubble. Crews are preserving the scene, as LAPD and CAL OSHA have been notified for investigation due to the fatality being at a work site. PIO Captain Erik Scott is responding for media requests, ETA 11:15am.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 CM20 CM22 E289 E290 E293 E60 E89 EM15 PI1 RA807 RA827 RA89 RA90 T89 T90 T93 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Technical Rescue; INC#0447; 08:47AM; 10505 N Glenoaks Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/43s4JPo; #Pacoima; Firefighters arrived to find a cinder block wall fell and trapped one patient, and injuring another. One patient with back pain has been transported. Firefighters are currently working to extricate the trapped patient (still conscious) from under the wall.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E289 E290 E293 E60 E89 EM15 RA807 RA827 RA89 RA90 T89 T90 T93 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Knockdown - #SichelFire Major Emergency Structure Fire 06/07/2023 INC#0075

item.description: Knockdown - #SichelFire Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0075; 02:55AM; 1773 N Sichel St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NfULLk; #LincolnHeights; 120 LAFD Firefighters took 95 minutes in largely defensive firefighting operations to confine flames within a heavily damaged 13,500 square-foot two-story commercial building that housed storage for an event planning business. No injury. Firefighters will remain at scene well into the morning to coordinate salvage and overhaul a large amount of smoldering debris, with LAFD Heavy Equipment (Loader/Excavator) summoned to assist them, due to the physical instability of the 70 year-old structure. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM21 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E21 E212 E220 E235 E250 E3 E4 E44 E9 EA1 EM1 HE1 HR3 RA1 RA2 RA3 RA47 RA801 RA803 SQ21 T1 T12 T2 T20 T3 T35 T50 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire #SichelFire 06/07/2023 INC#0075

item.description: Update #SichelFire Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0075; 02:10AM; 1773 N Sichel St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NfULLk; #LincolnHeights; With 116 Firefighters assigned in defensive operations, this incident, known as the "Sichel Fire" has escalated to Major Emergency status, as LAFD crews continue to battle intense flames within a 13,500 square-foot two-story commercial building housing an event planning business. No injury.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E21 E212 E220 E235 E250 E3 E4 E44 E9 EM1 HR3 RA1 RA2 RA3 RA47 RA801 RA803 SQ21 T1 T12 T2 T20 T3 T35 T50 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/07/2023 INC#0075

item.description: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0075; 01:52AM; 1773 N Sichel St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NfULLk; #LincolnHeights; Defensive operations continue thirty minutes into the firefight, with 96 LAFD Firefighters battling intense flames in what is now described as a 100' x 150' *two-story* commercial building (yet unknown type business) heavily involved with fire, with flames threatening *at least one* adjacent building. No injury.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E212 E250 E3 E4 E44 EM1 HR3 RA1 RA2 RA3 RA47 RA801 RA803 SQ21 T1 T12 T2 T3 T50 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0075; 01:20AM; 1773 N Sichel St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NfULLk; #LincolnHeights; PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations on 100' x 150' one-story commercial building heavily involved with fire, with flames threatening two adjacent buildings. ; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E212 E250 E3 E4 E44 EM1 HR3 RA1 RA2 RA801 RA803 SQ21 T1 T12 T2 T3 T50 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#1608; 09:09PM; 450 E Bauchet St; MAP: https://bit.ly/45NbdtS; #Chinatown; PRELIM: LAFD assisting the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department (LASD) with two suddenly ill persons (unconfirmed age/gender/condition/affiliation) following their exposure to a yet to be identified substance within a Sheriff's jail facility. Both patients are being transported to an area hospital. Because no off-site or escalating hazard has been identified at this time, *All Media Inquiries* Will Be Handled By the LASD Information Bureau.; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 E2 E21 E221 E229 E29 E4 E95 EM1 JT2 JT6 RA17 RA29 RA3 RA4 RA803 RA829 SQ21 SQ95 T21 T29; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1052; 02:50PM; 2545 W Riverside Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MUuQYs; #SilverLake; PRELIM: School bus (unknown operator / departure or destination) with minor damage after apparently being rear-ended by a compact car. At least two occupants, believed to be (unknown age/gender) "students", are being evaluated by LAFD Paramedics for reportedly minor complaints. No further details. Media Inquiries: CHP Central L.A. (Log #1580) notified and responding per protocol for an incident involving an occupied school bus. ; FS 56; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E220 E250 EM11 RA209 RA55 RA809 RA815 T20 T50; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey
